content:
I am attempting to make a P2P semantic search engine with Rust targeting WASM. I'm a newb but in order to learn a language I usually have to learn by doing.

Are there any good NLP crates I should know about?
(Your question is welcome here, but you may have more answers on the Rust community Discord)
When I joined the discord all the messages said to join zulipchat instead. I thought it was inactive, am I looking at the wrong one?
I think that you joined the official discord and not the community discord.
How do I join the community discord? I found the official discord from the Rust site.
(Or they also have this link apparently: https://bit.ly/rust-community)
You can also try asking on the forums: users.rust-lang.org :smile:

ender said:

When I joined the discord all the messages said to join zulipchat instead. I thought it was inactive, am I looking at the wrong one?

Hmm, it's pretty active! Some people have had glitches with joining it for some reason. You can try again, and then ask in #beginners on the official Discord.

There is a smaller Slack channel as well which is a little more low-volume but
therefore also easier to digest and still quite helpful.

I'm not sure rust is ready yet to handle nlp stuff. A language like Julia or python is likely much more supported for these tasks by their ecosystem. However, I'm not sure if it's easy to target wasm with these languages.

There's a few crates however, that you could look into: https://lib.rs/search?q=nlp

Well, there's various kinds of search engines, and not all need (or even are greatly improved by...) NLP. Obviously Rust is trivially worse for NLP, though, next to a verrry well-developed ecosystem for it like Python.

( but here I show my bias: I prefer it when search engines can be programmed versus when they try to parse me, so I prefer it when the parameters are easily and transparently manipulated... structured text. )
The question is what sort of application it is being put to in the search engine, though.
I don't think that Julia is especially good for NLP atm
